title: Paloma Recipe
description: Paloma is a Mexican cocktail made with tequila, lime, and grapefruit soda served over ice for a cool and refreshing holiday drink.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Latin American Mexican Paloma 4.9 (13) 11 Reviews 5 Photos Paloma is a delicious tequila cocktail that is a favorite in Mexico. It's a light and fruity drink with fizz — a great alternative to a margarita. Submitted by shasty Updated on September 21, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 1 Yield: 1 cocktail Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 1 servings 2 fluid ounces tequila 1 ½ tablespoons lime juice 1 pinch salt 3 cubes ice, or as desired 6 fluid ounces diet grapefruit soda Directions Combine the tequila, lime juice, and salt in a tall glass. Add ice, top off with diet grapefruit soda, and stir. Cook’s Note Almost any blanco tequila works well in combination with the grapefruit.You may also see this cocktail with grapefruit juice and a splash of soda like Squirt, Fresca, or Mexican Jarritos. Next time I’ll use diet Squirt to save a few calories! name: shasty
instructions: Combine the tequila, lime juice, and salt in a tall glass. Add ice, top off with diet grapefruit soda, and stir.
